p: The Megazyme method allows to assess the total content of branched and non-branched glucan particles. The method consists of the hydrolysis of polysaccharides to the basic d-glucose molecules [ 14, 62]. However, enzymatic methods do not allow for a separate evaluation of the content of triple-helix Î²-glucans. Therefore, for these compounds, the method of triple extraction with aqueous solutions of alkalia and acids according to Nitschke et al. [ 29] was used.
